meanings.definition: A type of B vitamin essential for cell growth and metabolism.
meanings.sent1: Folacins are important for helping our cells grow and stay healthy.
meanings.sent2: Doctors recommend including folacins in your diet to support cell growth.
meanings.sent3: I forgot to take my folacins today, so my cells might be on strike!
meanings.sent4: Her energy seemed to increase after she started taking folacins regularly.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant green vegetables were like a garden of folacins, nurturing every cell in her body.

meanings.sent1: The store had a sale on folacins, so I bought a few bottles.
meanings.sent2: She asked the pharmacist for folacins, and he handed her a pack of vitamins.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spilled the folacins all over the kitchen counter, creating a colorful mess.
meanings.sent4: The folacins on the shelf looked like tiny soldiers ready to boost my health.
meanings.sent5: The folacins in the jar sparkled like precious gems, promising vitality with each dose.
